intro: Diapedium acuminatum, commonly known as the sharp-pointed diapedium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Diapedium acuminatum is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along riverbanks.
